decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and activate Pyromancer Ascension for extra power. The deck utilizes cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Faithless Looting to enable the powerful synergy between Arclight Phoenix, Pyromancer Ascension, and other graveyard recursion. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and aggressive creatures, while controlling the board with versatile cards like Thing in the Ice and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to close out games quickly through a combination of direct damage and recursion.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through the use of artifacts and disruptive effects. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's ability to attack by utilizing cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Bottled Cloister. Additionally, it utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void and Damping Sphere to hinder the opponent's playstyles. The deck also includes various artifact recursion cards like Crucible of Worlds and Academy Ruins to maintain advantage and resilience. The deck is supported by cards like Whir of Invention and Ancient Stirrings to search for and assemble the necessary pieces for its control strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with Dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, so that you can constantly bring back creatures like Bloodghast and Narcomoeba for free. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to draw more cards and discard Dredge cards, you can create a powerful engine that can overwhelm your opponent with a high number of creatures and triggers. Cards like Life from the Loam and Conflagrate also provide additional value and finishers for the deck.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with cards and efficiently bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. Utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Thought Scour, and Manamorphose to quickly power out spells while controlling the opponent's creatures with removal like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Axe. It also includes some card draw and selection with Opt and Serum Visions to dig for key pieces. Pyromancer Ascension is included to double up on key spells, while Snapcaster Mage provides extra value by reusing spells from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on aggressively lowering your own life total in order to power up Death's Shadow and utilize its powerful abilities. It includes a mix of cheap spells and creature threats to quickly pressure the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through a combination of powerful creatures and combat tricks, utilizing the synergy between cards like Temur Battle Rage and Become Immense to deal large amounts of damage in a single turn. By carefully managing your life total and resources, the deck can overwhelm opponents with its speed and efficiency.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Shriekhorn, and then use Life from the Loam to continuously dredge cards back into your hand. This allows you to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast, while also dealing damage with cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats and value from the graveyard, ultimately leading to a win through a combination of creature attacks and burn spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. By using Life from the Loam to repeatedly return lands from the graveyard to hand, the deck can trigger powerful effects from its graveyard like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats from the graveyard and quickly close out the game before the opponent can react.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle combo as quickly as possible to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards like Scapeshift, Through the Breach, Primeval Titan, and Valakut itself to enable this powerful synergy. By ramping up mana with cards like Farseek, Search for Tomorrow, and Hour of Promise, the deck aims to play its key combo pieces early in the game to overwhelm the opponent with hasty Valakut triggers and burn spells like Lightning Bolt.

This aggressive red deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for casting spells, while Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear provide consistent early pressure. Boros Charm and Lightning Bolt offer versatile removal and reach, while Searing Blaze and Lava Spike help maintain board presence and apply pressure. The deck is focused on a fast, efficient game plan of dealing damage quickly and efficiently to outpace the opponent and win the game before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on maximizing the power of +1/+1 counters by utilizing cards like Hardened Scales, Arcbound Ravager, and Steel Overseer. By quickly increasing the size of creatures like Hangarback Walker and Walking Ballista, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with their aggressive threats. The inclusion of cards like Animation Module and Mox Opal provide additional synergies and ways to generate more value from +1/+1 counters. The land base is carefully crafted to support the aggressive strategy, with cards like Inkmoth Nexus and Pendelhaven offering additional options for closing out games.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to flip Thing in the Ice and trigger Arclight Phoenix. Utilizing cheap cantrips such as Opt and Serum Visions, along with cards like Manamorphose and Faithless Looting, allows for consistent spellcasting. Pyromancer Ascension is essential for multiplying spell effects, while Lightning Bolt and Lightning Axe provide removal. Remand offers tempo advantage, while Surgical Extraction deals with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized for casting spells quickly and efficiently, ensuring a fast-paced aggressive strategy to overwhelm opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently and aggressively play Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, using cheap spells like Gut Shot, Lightning Bolt, and Thought Scour to trigger its ability. The deck aims to control the board with Thing in the Ice while also utilizing Crackling Drake and Pteramander for additional threats. Strong card draw and manipulation with cards like Serum Visions and Faithless Looting help ensure a consistent game plan while keeping pressure on the opponent. Surgical Extraction provides disruption and a way to deal with problematic cards in the opponent's deck.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cheap spells, trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability to return them to the battlefield, and overpower the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan. The deck focuses on efficiently cycling through the deck, utilizing cheap and effective spells like Faithless Looting and Manamorphose to cast multiple spells in a turn and bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. It also includes disruption and removal elements like Lightning Bolt and Surgical Extraction to control the game and push for a swift victory.

This deck utilizes a combination of artifacts and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect itself. By using cards like Chalice of the Void and Ensnaring Bridge, the deck can prevent the opponent from playing their key spells and attacking. Cards like Whir of Invention and Ancient Stirrings help dig for important pieces, while cards like Welding Jar and Crucible of Worlds provide recursion and protection for key artifacts. The deck aims to lock down the board and control the game until it can find a way to win, often through a combination of damage or mill effects.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board by using various artifacts and spells to disrupt their strategy. It relies on using cards like Witchbane Orb, Tormod's Crypt, and Damping Sphere to hinder their opponent's plans while also having win conditions like Ensnaring Bridge and Engineered Explosives to finish the game. The deck has a toolbox of artifacts and land manipulation cards like Crucible of Worlds and Tectonic Edge, allowing it to adapt to different situations and outmaneuver the opponent. Its goal is to outlast and outsmart the opponent through resource denial and strategic plays.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, while also disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also has removal spells such as Assassin's Trophy and Fatal Push to deal with any threats the opponent may have. Additionally, cards like Tireless Tracker and Scavenging Ooze provide extra value and help the deck stay ahead in resources. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent to secure a win.
